intro: Cremastosperma cauliflorum, commonly known as the tropical climbing vine, is a member of the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, white, tubular flowers that are typically borne in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. This species is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
